question_text: Which of the following BEST explains why an APIPA-assigned device may be unable to communicate with other APIPA-assigned devices on the same subnet?
answer_options: APIPA does not support multicast traffic
The network switch blocks self-assigned traffic
The devices are on different VLANs
APIPA disables DNS resolution by default
correct_answer: The devices are on different VLANs
explanation: Although APIPA allows local communication, VLAN segmentation can prevent devices from seeing each other even on the same IP range.
